name: The Roosevelt New Orleans, A Waldorf Astoria Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending the day traversing the French Quarter, nothing beat going back to our glorious suite at The Roosevelt. Beautiful decor and superb service make this hotel stand out as a sure thing in New Orleans. The old architecture draws you in to explore the lobby and delve into its past. The Blue Room, known for it's lavish affairs from World War I and the question of where Huey Long's "box" could be located. We picked one of the perfect times to go check out this lovely hotel, Christmas. Decked to the nines, as well as the halls, you couldn't help but be mesmerized. Will be more than happy to go back to The Roosevelt again!
reviews.title: A Beautiful Respite in a Fun Packeted City

reviews.text: We spent three nights over Thanksgiving in a luxurty suite at the hotel.
reviews.title: Staff a cut above

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was very nice, but the service from the hotel is what exceeded our expectations. My husband forget a few articles of clothing in a drawer when we checked out. When we called to check if they found it, we were immediately connected w/ secuirty which checked their computer, Yes, it had been found; they sent it to us via UPS the next day. The service our entire stay was always prompt, courteous and better than we expected.
reviews.title: So much fun in the Big Easy

reviews.text: My wife and I spend a wonderful week in New Orleans in Oct. What a fantastic time. We stayed at the beautiful Roosevelt Hotel on Baronne street. This property is without a doubt the finest hotel in down town New Orleans. Everything was new and clean and restored to its formal glory. World class food and service with the exception of the help and staff in the coffee shop. These guys had a real attitude and we heard several other guests complaining about them. The good news is there is a Star Bucks just one block toward the river.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Roosevelt right across Canal street from the French Quarter. We walked to the French Market for Breakfast in the morning. We caught the Garden District trolley right outside the front door of the hotel ($3.00 for a full day pass) We listened to the street musicians. (Our favorite was a seven piece band call Skinny Tuba) We ate great food every night. There is so much to do in this lovely town. We just had a blast.
reviews.title: Worth the price

reviews.text: Stayed in room 21050 (10th floor) for four nights. This is a one-bedroom suite with a king bed. Very end of the hallway and super quiet. The Roosevelt is quite nice. Service is excellent. Short walk to French Quarter and Bourbon Street, but far enough away that it’s not crazy/loud. Wal-greens on corner.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, close to the action but mellow

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: The allure is greater than the actual stay...

reviews.text: Great service
reviews.title: Must stay hotel
All good!
reviews.text: Great bedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Robes/slippers
reviews.title: First timers - pleasant experience

reviews.text: It a city that can get a little seedy.....the Roosevelt sets itself apart.
reviews.title: Exactly what you would expect from a WA - perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has everything that you would expect from a Waldorf...
reviews.title: Great Christmas Decorations and Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Beautiful property - especially when its decorated for Christmas
reviews.title: A holiday or any day delight

reviews.text: - Very attentive and helpful staff
reviews.title: Great location in a great town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Nice extras - turndown service
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location just off Canal Street, within walking distance to French Quarter. Nicely restored, old world charm, excellent staff, comfortable rooms and has wonderful restaurant Domenica.
reviews.title: Roosevelt Hotel

reviews.text: The concierge staff is first rate, very helpful. Expensive but worth it.
reviews.title: Great old fashioned hotel, whether 5 star or not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just stayed 2 nights in the Roosevelt Waldorf in New Orleans, and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is old fashioned (old brass elevators, plished floors, famous bar, etc.), and I would give it a good review for those items alone. However, the rooms were very nicely updated and were quiet as a mouse, so I also slept like a baby (when I ordinarily do not). Nice place plus great sleep equals fantastic stay. I got upgrade to a king superior room, and had asked for a high floor away from the street. They have two interior facing groups of rooms (no good view but quiet), and it was well worth the lack of view. Canal St adjacent to the building (and very nearby Bourbon St) can be very noisy, but I heard none of it. The interior doors and hallways were quiet, and the walls between the rooms were absolutely noise free. My only complaints were that nothing was complimentary (no breakfast, no free business center), but that seems to be the way of big city nice hotels. I stayed at two other NOLA hotels in this trip, and this was my favorite hands down. Whether it was a true 5 star hotel or not is really immaterial. Not sure that any hotel I;ve stayed at qualifies, IMHO. Room was clean and renovated, carpet and bathroom were recent. Hilton Honors member? This is a no-brainer for NOLA. Best of the bunch, no questions!
reviews.title: A good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good hotel in New Orleans. The room was lovely, the staff very proficient, and the concierge good at what they do. We got an email from them a few weeks before we were due there asking if we need assitacnce with any other bookings. That was a nice touch and we did use them to arrange a couple of tours that went well. I'm almost used to the sillness of having to pay extra for things like interent but $16 odd dollars a night is getting a bit out there. No coffee maker in the room which is a pain as I need a constant supply otherwise my system shuts down. The other thing to watch for is because they have the whole doorman, concierge, bell desk, reception thing as seperate entities commuication can break down. The first request for assistance getting the bags brought down at check out didn't get through so that added a bit of time to leaving for the airport.
reviews.title: October 2010 Birthday Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants and cafes in the hotel are very good and worth using for their own sake, not just becasue they are close. The hotel is close enough to things like Bourbon St to be easily walkable without having to be on top of them.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect! Dee's Massage at the Guerlain Spa is INCREDIBLE!

reviews.text: Great location to walk to Bourbon St. Beautiful property, great roof top pool & bar. Room was very nice, comfortable for 3 adults. All staff was VERY professional. Went to a party in the Blue Room that was fun.
reviews.title: Nothin' but good

reviews.text: great location. close walk to festivities. fantastic staff. we did encounter a problem in our room. the ac vent filter leaked on to the floor. maintenance came to fix right away. some of our clothes got wet from being on the floor under the vent. they did our laundry quickly and for free. it's a bit expensive but i really enjoyed staying here. it was a beautiful hotel. rooms were nice and clean. we didn;t eat here, but did have a few drinks (expensive) at the bar.
reviews.title: it's a great place to stay if you can afford it

reviews.text: Short and Suite: Brief overnight, didn't get a chance to truly explore the hotel however I felt safe, comfortable and welcome. I hope to go back for a long stay in the future, it is a great location and has many amenities.
reviews.title: New Orleans flair and solid choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do you research, if you aren't up to paying $40 to Valet park your car, drop you bags off at the hotel and park in one of the garages on Iberville across Canal and walk like I did.
reviews.title: Better than I thought it could be...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room Service: Excellant breakfast however juice, coffee, sides add up fast. j
reviews.title: Great First Impression

reviews.text: Very accommodating staff, nice rooms, good food. Highly recommend dining at Domenica (a John Besh eatery) in the hotel. The Carrie Me Away cocktail is excellent. So is the Garganelli pasta dish - very flavorful! Skip Sazerac restaurant for food (lunch their was not very good). Cold oysters on salad, never got extra dressing I ordered. Was there for a conference but would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great experience at Ghe Roosevelt

reviews.text: Immaculately restored hotel located i block across Canal Street from the French Quarter and away from the crowds. Responsive staff. Ultra quiet and spacious room. Beautiful block-long lobby, great people watching bar and home to Domenica restaurant serving John Besh and Alon Shaya cuisine.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was perfect. The hotel is beautiful and the service is top notch. We didn't have a great view, but it really didn't matter. The room is perfectly clean with high end amenities like a nice clock radio with ipod dock, huge shower with full body shower heads, great linens, and the nicest hair dryer I have ever seen in a hotel. The bar was classic and fun, and hopping at all hours. The pool is wonderful and many guests took advantage of it. The location is perfect for the trolley stop and right across from Bourbon Street, but sheltered from the noise. An all around great place to stay!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
True luxury
reviews.text: This hotel made our stay in New Orleans the best we have ever had. Being on the edge of the French Quarter made it convenient but away for the crowds. The room was spacious and well maintained. The bar was active and a great place to relax. The concierge and valet services were superb. After this wonderful experience this is the only place we will stay when in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful old hotel, but renovated very well. Our king suite was extremely comfortable and quiet. We didn't like our first room (overlooked pool and A/C units) and front desk was happy to switch us. They were also very understanding when we had to cut our stay short to get home before Sandy. Concierge August was very helpful. Location is perfect, short walk from both the Quarter and the restaurants in the CBD/warehouse district. Room was bright but didn't have a view of very much (apparently few rooms in the hotel do). One thing I found slightly annoying is that maid service is done between 9am-5pm, so if you go out for the morning/early afternoon, your room isn't always made up when you come back. Domenica is a great restaurant, nice alternative after many days of Creole food. Parking right across the street is only $15 a day (and I think that's where they park the $40/day valet cars anyway).
reviews.title: Very nice and beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location if you want to be near, but not in, the French Quarter. Beautiful hotel lobby and restaurants. The king room was reasonably sized and the quality of the bed, furniture, TV, lights, art, really everything was fantastic. Was pleased they offered free in-room wireless internet. Spa was small but pleasant. Staff and service was excellent. Value was amazing because we had a group rate. It would still be worth the price at near rack rate.
reviews.title: Best of New Orleans

reviews.text: We stayed at the Roosevelt for the second time since the re-branding and renovation.
reviews.title: Five star rooms, two star service

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The service is still disappointing. Upon arrival, we were approached by the bellman who seemed less than thrilled that we were arriving. I asked the bellman to bring in my ice chest. Without even looking to see what type of ice chest, he immediately said that I was not allowed to have an ice chest. He stated that guest with ice chest tend to do a great deal of damage at the hotel. Never mind that it was a very small ice chest big enough to hold insulin and the lunch that we consumed on the drive. We were reasonably well dressed for a six hour drive and we drive a luxury vehicle (we do not look like thugs at 50 years of age).
reviews.title: a trip back in time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the pervasive attitude with most employees. The waiter at Teddy's was surly.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.text: Spent a week there for a combination business meeting and mini vacation with my wife (left the kids at home!). The check-in process was smooth and efficient. The young lady at the desk was friendly, helpful and sincere. The fifth floor corner room was very nice, beautifully appointed and had a great view. The only thing that was disappointing about it was the size ... I travel often, and this was one of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in Great Location!

reviews.text: The bathroom was nice, except the toilet seat was broken and would slide to one side when you sat on it ... you had to be "lite on your seat" so to speak when using it! It only had a stand-up shower, no tub, so my wife was a little disappointed as well ... she was looking forward to a nice soak!
reviews.title: Five stars, great location with old world charm

reviews.text: The only in-room dining experience I had was a disaster. After three follow-up calls and three visits by wait staff, I gave up, disposed of half of the food and contacted the General Manager. He was very apologetic and adjusted the charges off my bill. Never tried in-room dining after that. I did attend a luncheon and two very nice dinners associated with the annual meeting I was attending, and the food was fantastic! I never ate in any of the restaurants, but can only imagine that if the food is the same, then the restaurants must be fantastic as well.
reviews.title: In the quarter
First Quiet Stay in NOLA
reviews.text: The hotel offered a nightly turn-down service with pillow mints. The lobby was amazing, decorated with Christmas lights and trees nearly the entire length. School choirs came and sang carols in the lobby almost every day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located just a block from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. It was only a fifteen minute walk to Cafe Du Monde for the best beignets. Made a great base for exploring the area.
reviews.title: Service leaves a lot to be Desired

description: The Roosevelt Hotel New Orleans, a Waldorf Astoria hotel, provides guests with a sense of history and place. Offering 504 luxuriously appointed guestrooms and suites, The Roosevelt is adjacent to the French Quarter and is convenient to all New Orleans attractions. The hotel features Guerlain Spa and Fitness Center, Fountain Lounge and Sazerac Bar, and Chef John Besh’s Domenica. Spacious guestrooms offer luxurious linens, flat-screen TVs, refreshment centers, bathrobes, safes, and 24 hour in-room dining.
